reviews: This has been so amazing for my skin! It has cleared and brightened my complexion. The moisturizer is hydrating, but does not make my combination skin oily. The eye cream has helped the darkness under my eyes. The serum has helped fade acne scars. I just bought the full sizes - two weeks of use has convinced me of its super powers! I have noticed such a difference in my face in such a short amount of time - I can't wait to see the results after months of use! And did I mention the packaging is lovely? :)I also bought the exfoliating clay mask - LOVE! I highly recommend these products. They are worth the money. The products I have used from the drugstore either leave my face dry and tight, or oily - both of which will cause breakouts. The high-end products I have used causes purging - and then weeks of scarring that takes forever to fade. Tula products feel - and smell - so good; no oily residue, a clean feeling that does not cause dryness, no noticeable purging, and it helps fade old scars and dark spots. Plus, they aren't tested on animals - which is so wonderful, and sadly so hard to find.Keep it up, Tula! You have a lifelong customer right here! So far so good. I like things with no fragrance. I have had no irritation and my skin looks good. I think this is a good line for people with very sensitive skin like myself. I'm allergic to everything but this is workin nicely! I'll keep ordering Really great stuff!  My skin looks and feels amazing. Was a bit worried about the fragrance due to my extremely sensitive skin, but my skin didn't react badly from it. Especially loved the Illuminating Face Serum.  It's wonderful that they have this kit to try out before buying full sized products. Would definitely recommend! I'm loving this kit and using it as a travel set. I love that it came in it's own little travel pouch. Will order again. I am 57 years of age. I spent a lot of my teenage years at the beach exposing my face. I never wore sunscreens.  So far, I have been using the product for approximately 3 weeks. I do like the results. My skin does feel very clean and moisturized and healthy! So far, so good. I would definitely recommend this product. Great product line; simple; there aren't 101 products in the line that you have to wade through to decide which ones are right for you and they truly make my skin look and feel better.  Well worth it. Perfect size to travel with, with a really good amount of product in the small tubes. The products go on smooth to your skin and it doesn’t feel like you have anything on your face. Nice introduction to this product. Can definitely see a change in my skin, even tone and minimizing wrinkles. The ingredients are natural . Will definitely consider making part of my daily skin routine. I'm literally in LOVE with all of my TULA products!  Highly recommend. In love with these. Wish the full size products were not so expensive. This is absolutely the best. Can see and feel the difference and I am 70 Excellent product from an excellent seller!!  Highly recommend. Just love this product.  Will buy again. nice starter kit, generous products, not skimpy. Feels great on my skin, so far so good I like it  so much!! Love the brand.  My skin feels really nourished. Love it. I'm giving this five starts mainly for the illuminating serum. I freaking love that stuff! The rest I can take or leave. This set is great for travel and came with a really nice travel bag! I don't have any complaints about the fave wash, eye cream, or moisturizer it just doesn't wow me like the illuminating serum! The serum gives you that glowing dewy look everyone wants and seems to make my mineral foundation go on smoother when I use it before putting on makeup! I have been using TULA starter kit for a couple days now and I absolutely love it. The kit includes purifying face cleanser - 1 fl oz, illuminating face serum - 0.5 fl oz, hydrating day and night cream - 0.5 oz and revitalizing eye cream -0.25 oz. It all comes in a pretty silver color travel bag. So it's a perfect traveling kit that has everything you need to take care of your face skin. The purifying face cleanser is very gentle, feels good on my skin, hydrates it right after application, creates creamy foam with water. The illuminating face serum has a bit liquid texture, it absorbs to skin fast and doesn't feel greasy. It leaves my skin moisturized right away and it also has light pleasant scent. The hydrating day and night cream has a bit heavier texture and it's perfect for night time skin hydration. It leaves my skin really smooth. The revitalizing eye cream works very good on my eye area, moisturizes skin and leaves it feeling fresh, my eyes don't feel tired. I didn't get any skin reaction or irritation using these products. I love that it contains beautiful ingredients like blueberry fruit extract, lemon and orange oils, turmeric and chicory root extracts, grape seed oil and jojoba seed oil extracts and much more. The main that it contains milk protein and yogurt extracts that are so good for skin and make it youthful, fresh and healthy. I am very happy with my purchase and recommend it to all women who love to use high quality, natural skin care products. I received this product at a discount price in exchange for my honest opinion. I received this product kit over a month ago, and I decided to wait on writing a review so I could use it and give an honest review about my experience with this brand.  This set is perfect for those who just want to try it before committing to the regular size products. I've been using this Tula Kit for over a month and I have noticed an improvement on my skin. The cleanser is a gentle gel and it foams as you add water. The eye treatment is a smooth cream and that one turned out to be one of my favorites. I use the serum and moisturizer together and it does not feel heavy on your skin, your skin absorbs it almost immediately and you will love the feeling that these two products do for your skin. I use this whole set at night so that my skin can absorb and take advantage of all the great things this set provides for your skin. I have noticed a huge difference in the morning, my skin feels soft, smooth and it looks healthy. Let me tell you that the scent of these products are absolutely fantastic, I wish I could have a perfume made of the scent because it is so pleasant and it puts me in such a great mood before bed. It's an elegant soft smell that just brings this whole set together. Not only does it smell great, but these products are amazing and they have provided me with great results. Now, I know not everyone's skin is the same. I normal to oily skin and break out on a regular basis, however, I haven't notice as many breakouts since I started using Tula. Overall, I absolutely love this skin care set and the brand. The only CON to this brand is their prices. Because this is a started kit it the price wasn't so bad. But I can't afford to pay $52 for just one full size product, however, I think I know what I will be adding to my Christmas gift list.I did receive this product at a discounted price for my honest unbiased opinion. I am not obligated by the seller to give a good review nor am I compensated for giving one. I rely on reviews to make a final purchase so I hope this review was helpful to you. Like most people, I have sensitive skin. Tried many products that didn't show any improvements. When I heard about the TULA line, I figured I should try it. Glad I did cause it has work for me. I have and use the whole Tula line. From the cleanser, exfoliating mask, neck cream, eye cream, day and night cream , illuminating serum, deep wrinkle serum. Love them all.. I bought this set like I have most other skincare products in my life, hoping it would be the solution for acne and evening my skin tone, but already thinking about what I would order when this didn't work. I was blown away by the results and after a week saw such an improvement I ordered the full size products and have been using them since. The science behind the products absolutely works. This starter kit is ABSOLUTELY perfect to try out (almost) all of Tula's products. You get to try a combo of 4 different products and they are just amazing. I've ordered 3 packs now just so I can use the eye cream and face wash for travel. They are the perfect size and last surprisingly long! Presentation on this 4 piece skin care line was impressive.....tissue paper and all!  Pumps work good and consistency of lotion and creams are nice.  I tried it once so far and my skin feels great.  I received this product at a discount for my honest review. I will not travel anywhere without my travel set! It's the perfect size of my absolute favorite products. I no longer need to re-bottle my Tula products because Tula makes it so easy to travel with! Thanks Tula :) Start Here!  This is the exact set that caused me to fall in love with TULA. The cleanser is so kind to the skin and leaves it refreshed, but not tight.The other 3 core products exceeded my high expectations. I saw reduced redness and fine lines. TULA leaves a glow to my skin that I've never experienced with other skin care lines. The ingredients are steeped in a history of health giving benefits and the added probiotics...well that makes perfect sense to me. And my skin agrees. Prepare to fall in love with TULA and the way your skin looks.

Great addition to the Vanicream lotion for very sensitive skin.  Love the double pack! Great product With a fragrance allergy, I have to be careful about the soaps I use. Everything in the Vanicream/Vaniply/Free & Clear lines has worked great for me and hasn't irritated my skin. These are small bottles for the price, so I just ordered the 32-oz. refill so I can pour that into the pumps. This body wash lathers well and doesn't smell like anything. It's not too drying, but doesn't leave a film. I use this because of specific chemical skin allergies I have to dimethylaminopropylamine (a byproduct of cocamidopropyl betaine,) diagnosed by an allergist&dermatologist. Thank goodness for this product! I have sensitive skin and this doesn't negatively affect my hands like so many products do. I use it over and over. Great stuff, especially if you have sensitive skin. Costs way more than the regular stuff but if you have skin allergies like I do, it is worth it. Recommended by Dermatolgist.  love it ! Some soaps can make a skin problem worse. This one is safe and effective. Love this soap! Makes an excellent face wash for sensitive skin and leaves my skin feeling very clean without drying it out or leaving a residue. It was so good to find Free and Clear products once I was diagnosed with sensitive skin. all my itches have gone. The only thing that has helped my daughter’s eczema. Two days of using this lotion and it was completely clear after months of horrible rash looking skin that itched so bad she would scratch constantly, sometimes until she bled. Great lotion!! I like this body wash. I do think it helps with my dry skin problem. It helps control the itching. My son and I both have eczema and have difficulty finding body wash that isn't irritating to our skin. After a few weeks of using the product we have experienced no issues. Great product This is my favorite facial cleanser for the last 3 years. I went through many products until I found this one (Philosophy Purity was the last one before that). I used to have a mixed to oily and acne prone skin, but since I started using this product my face cleared up and I don't breakout that often. The ugly - "can't hide acne" stage is over and my skin tone is even now. You have to definitely try it if you still have acne in your late 30s. Pretty good for acne prone skin thays been through torture ,recently ...my dermatologist suggested it. Gentle enough for makeup removing as well.Thank you Really Fragrance-Free and it works!Free&Clear and Vanicream products are perfect for me because I'm allergic to most fragrances. They have minimal ingredients, so fewer things to be allergic to. And they work well. I use the Hair Gel, Shampoo, Conditioner, Skin Cream, Lite Lotion, Vaniply Ointment, and Liquid Cleanser. All are great products and I am really grateful for the lack of perfumes, masking fragrances, and unneeded botanical ingredients that could cause allergies.The Liquid Cleanser doesn't dry out my skin. It also works as a shampoo in a pinch. Great for a person who has multiple allergies and food sensitivities.  Lathers nicely and rinses off exceptionally well,  no slimy residue left after washing. Probably too drying if you have really dry skin, but great if you're really oily or only a little dry. Great if you're dealing with acne, totally non-comedogenic. No fatty alcohols or irritating sulfates. Note what it is now being sold for here at Amazon.  Still about $8 on eBay and Canadian pharmacy websites). I tried all four of the Axe Facial Washes for men including the Axe Cooling Face Wash, Chilled, 5 Ounce which was nice, the Axe Oily Skin Face Scrub, Controil, 5 Ounce(their sp error) which did what it was supposed to but I'm a little unused to efoliating products and found it a little harsh. I then  tried the Axe Energizing Face Wash, Boost, 5 Ounce which I liked quite well , but then I finally I tried THIS one, the AXE Foaming Face Wash, Shield 4.2 ounce.  Sometimes it's good to try an entire line.  From just looking at them I would not have guessed that the foaming face wash would be my favorite but there ya go! It is simple to use in the shower and that may be what won me over.  I don't have to pick up a tube, open it up and squeeze out product.  The dispenser can sit securely on my in-shower shelf and I just dispense what I need.  I then foam it up, work it into my face and especially my beard, leaving it on while I shampoo my hair and do everything else.  I rinse it out before rinsing my hair conditioner. I find that this product, used in that manner, helps soften my beard better for a closer shave.  Like all Axe products, it has a scent but a mild one that fades very quickly.I'm not a really fussy guy about my appearance and Axe's earlier image of being for guys who go to clubs to hit on women never sat well with me.  It seems now that they've gotten away from that and are making things for your average career guy who just wants to up his game a little and look more put together.  I now use a couple of their hair products regularly and the Foaming Face Wash is  getting added to my list of preferred grooming items.  If I had to pick one thing about it I liked better than the convenience and beard softening effect it would be that my face didn't feel tight afterwards like it does with some soaps and body washes nor did it feel greasy and slimy like when I tried my wife's Olay Total Effects Body Wash Deep Penetrating Moisture, 8.40 Ounce (Pack of 2) and stupidly washed my face with it as well. Now THAT was a mistake of epic proportions!  I'm gonna stick with the Axe Foaming wash now.  it's a very simple routine and costs a lot less than the department store mens products my wife has bought for me in the past.Axe Foaming Face wash is a good inexpensive product that I will continue to use. This does not have a lemon scent. I like lemon scents, and I always think when I see yellow it'll be lemon, this isn't. It does have a very nice manly scent and it isn't bad, it just isn't lemon. So if you think it is lemon because it is dyed yellow, it isn't.It does however seem to clean very very well. I've tried a few different brands recently and I like this one the best. I have very oily skin and it cleans it very well.Additionally it has little exfoliating bits in it. Many face washes claim to have the little beads, but often there aren't enough, or they aren't abrasive enough, or they settle to the bottom of the bottle and they never come out. This bottle is designed to dispense from the bottom, so the latter problem is not encountered. Additionally it has plenty of beads and they're quite abrasive.All told, I think I'll buy it again, though I do wish for a lemon scent, I find it refreshing. This is a good facial cleanser that leaves your face feeling like you just wiped it with a nice menthol or very subtle witch hazel. There is no witch hazel in this, but it leaves the feeling that is somewhere in between the two.These Axe products also all have a very nice invigorating scent that is often too musty, too generic or too obvious in other men's line products.I've since restocked this product but only wished that it came in a larger size, like a 10 or 12 ounce container. 5 ounces? Honestly, that's a bit "girly" LOL. Women are typically more conservative with the use of their product and not wasteful. I'm 32 with combination skin and some minor hormonal acne. My T-zone is oily, but around my nose and chin gets super dry during the winter months.  After years of trying new products to help balance my skin and eliminate breakouts, I've found the answer.As I've gotten older, harsh acne treatments only make my skin RAGE. I went straight back to the drugstore for this and the difference is remarkable.  I'm still able to spot-treat the blemishes, but this helps keep my skin hydrated so it doesn't crack and flake like a lizard.  (So gross!)I don't notice any strong perfumes, like some other people. I typically do two washes on my face to get everything off, but it leaves my skin feeling soft and hydrated.  Your skin shouldn't feel tight after cleansing.  If so, it's too harsh for you!If you have tried everything on the shelf and you continue to have new breakouts, I recommend making your skin care routine as simple and GENTLE as possible. The paranoia is real. Nice feel First, some background:  I'm twenty-five years old and I've been dealing with acne breakouts since my junior year of high school.  The first two years were really bad, but over time it's mellowed out.  I'm still classified by my dermatologist as having "adult acne," but all I have to worry about these days is a small area of skin on the right side of my chin.  That said, if I miss just one day of treating my skin with prescribed solutions and lotions, I will wake up the next morning with a terrible breakout.However, before I apply my prescription treatments, I have to make sure my face is very clean.  Previously I had been using Clean & Clear Foaming Facial Cleanser.  It got the job done as far as the breakouts went, but there were some drawbacks.  First, the smell was pretty awful.  More importantly though, it left my skin (particularly around my nose) very dry and sore - almost like frostbite.  It could even appear enflamed at times.  I actually had to get my dermatologist to prescribe some Desonide Lotion, just to treat the dryness.This Neutrogena Ultra Gentle Daily Cleanser smells infinitely better than the Clean & Clear, and, while it does leave a bit of facial tightening afterward, it doesn't dry my skin out anywhere near as badly.  I also have to say that the Amazon price is a great deal.  This is a pretty substantial bottle of cleanser.In short, I'm sold as a convert.  I'm trading in the Clean & Clear for Neutrogena. The St. Ives Even and Bright Pink Lemon and Mandarin Orange Scrub is a good lightly exfoliating facial scrub.  The scrub does a good job at exfoliating my skin without being harsh or overly abrasive, the scent is light and citrusy without being overpowering, and I haven't had issues with breakouts or skin irritation.  I actually really like this scrub in comparison to the Apricot Scrub, which is a bit too grainy and overly exfoliating.  While the scrub is effective at lightly cleaning and exfoliating, this scrub will not remove makeup, so you will need to remove your makeup before using this.  Also, be very careful not to get any of the bits into your eyes - I accidentally got a tiny grain in my eye, and while it didn't hurt, it was irritating as heck trying to get it out as it got right under my eye lid...ugh!  Overall this a nice addition to my daily face cleaning routine.  It helps slough away dead skin cells effectively and leaves my skin looking very fresh. This is an excellent scrub! It seems to refine the surface of the skin, but does not over-clean. If you have ever used an exfoliating cleaner (or any cleanser for that matter) that seems to remove every bit of oil from the surface of your skin, you may have noticed that your skin can sometimes pour out extra oil to compensate. Use it enough, and you'll discover that it can make your breakouts worse because your skin is so irritated. Burt's Bees will leave your skin feeling smoother, softer and most definitely not irritated. Give it a try, and I think you will be very satisfied. Over the last year or so, my acne has changed.  Instead of getting a few large, easily popped pimples that clear up mostly on my cheeks, I seem to have a smattering of very tiny but plentiful pimples across my forehead that are extremely difficult to pop or get rid of.  Any time I squeeze them, they would fill right back up the next day.I've been looking for something that would help right this change back to normal and after using this cleaner for a couple of weeks, I believe this (combined with the spot treatment stick) have done it for me.  I was taken aback at how delicious and natural this product smells.  It is really sweet and nature-y, and a little hard to describe but very good.  (The spot treatment stick, on the other hand, smells exactly like licorice.  Bleh!)I want to say something about the "greasy" feeling people have mentioned.  No, it won't leave your skin squeaky clean (or dried out for that matter) like many cleansers do.  This product utilizes jojoba oil which closely mimics the skin's own natural sebum.  THIS IS A GOOD THING!  For me, this was actually a very pleasant surprise.  Your skin won't be dried out after washing and while it may feel weird at first, it is quickly absorbed and you don't peel, itch or flake as a result.  I will leave you with something to think about and research, so keep an open mind when I say this: oil does not cause acne.  One more time, oil does not cause acne.  Dead skin cells and bacteria trapped in the pores cause acne.  I won't spend more time in my review on this, but you can research for yourself.  It is called The Oil Cleansing Method. Can't go wrong with Burt's Bees.  Works as intended Like others, I had been researching alternative facial cleansing products after having used Proactiv for years. Proactiv helped me tremendously during my teens but once I hit my 20's, it stopped working altogether. I began using a natural facial scrub by Desert Essence, along with diluted tea tree oil as a toner. This combination worked for a little while but the acne came back. I ran across Burt's Bees Acne Solutions while perusing at Target, read some reviews before purchasing anything from the line. I finally bought the Pore Refining Scrub as my daily cleanser (gel and cream cleansers don't work on my skin) along with the Toner. I have been using those two products for over a month now and my skin looks fantastic! There was a small initial outbreak once I first started using these but then it quickly went away. Now all that's left on my face are a few acne scars that I cover up with Bare Minerals Bisque Concealer (fabulous, by the way). I would recommend the Burt's Bees cleansing line to absolutely anyone. I wasn't expecting my skin to get completely clear, but man was it a nice surprise! As for just focusing on this scrub, I think it could use more of the scrubbing beads, but maybe that's because I'm just used to thicker scrubs. Someone below me stated that they felt as though this is just a cold cream. No, it is not thick like a cold cream at all. It is easy to spread across the face. Someone also said, maybe the same person, that it is hard to wash off. I don't find it hard to wash off, nor does it leave a film on my skin afterwards. You just need to take extra care in making sure those beads are washed off, as they like to hide along my hair line and in my eye brows. Plus, a nice damp wash cloth does the trick with washing any excess cleanser off of your face. If you're thinking about trying this scrub, or any products from this brand, just do it! You need to give it a month or longer before giving up, as sometimes the skin breaks out when a new cleanser is introduced to it. One of the first evening steps of my beauty routine, to cleanse your face without stripping it of moisture. This products is a crucial part of my routine, and lathers richly and smoothly with a lovely scent.Remember, your basic beauty routine should consist of approximately 5 - 10 steps;1. Makeup Removal (typically an oil)2. Facial Cleanse/Wash & Lip Scrub, to remove dead skin, buildup of oil, and any remaining makeup residue3. Toner, to rebalance and reintroduce moisture to your washed face4. Emulsion, to add more hydration to your balanced face5. Serum, to add special nourishment/anti-aging to your hydrated face6. Cream, to lock in everything7. Facial SPF, to protect (Day) or Night Pack (Night)8. Eye cream (Day formula is typically SPF, or Hydrating Night Eye Area Pack for night), to hydrate and/or protect the sensitive eye area9. Lip Pack (Day formula is typically SPF, or Hydrating Night Lip Pack for night), to keep exfoliated lips hydrated and protected thought the day or nightOptional additions include facial masks once or twice weekly and facial mists to keep a hydrated face throughout the day. There are certainly other additions to any routine, but what I've personally listed and numbered are what I find cover the basic length of a typical, daily and nightly Korean facial routine.As always, good luck and I wish you clear skin! Removing your makeup properly is the first step in a healthy skincare regime - and Aveeno "Positively Radiant" Makeup Removing Wipes do just that in one quick and easy, deeply nourishing wipe!I would absolutely recommend this product for the following reasons:No Residue:Some makeup removers leave a film that not only clogs pores - but also prevents skincare products from fully penetrating the skin and working their magic. Aveeno wipes are soap-free, oil-free, and leave no such residue.Gentle But Effective:A down-side to many wipes is that they just spread the makeup as you're removing to other parts of your face - so you end up with foundation in your eyes and mascara streaks on your cheeks! Aveeno wipes' lightly textured surface eliminates that challenge by lifting away dirt, oil, and makeup (even waterproof mascara) off your face and onto the wipe.5 Factors of Radiance:The "Positively Radiant" collection is uniquely formulated to target all 5 factors of radiance - tone, texture, dullness, blotchiness, brown spots. In less than a week, my skin was looking smoother, fresher, and more radiant. Aveeno's combination of moisture-rich soy extract with gentle cleansers nourish and deeply hydrate overnight. You literally wake up to better skin - just by removing your makeup with these wipes!Hypoallergenic and Non-Comedogenic:Aveeno's mild formula is gentle enough for everyday use even on sensitive skin.Makeup wipes often burn your eyes, but Aveeno wipes are gentle enough to use around my eyes and contact lenses - and no stinging over blemishes.The only recommendations I would have for Aveeno are:• A fragrance-free option for those extremely sensitive to scents/perfume• Perhaps a larger size towelette for those who wear lots of waterproof or heavy layers of makeup• More convenient packaging with a flip-top lid that dispenses wipes versus the peel/stick type Ok, I don't wear makeup but I do work with my hands and I constantly get grease and grime on my hands. So glad I can order this on Amazon because no one sells it anymore I love Image Vital C facial cleanser!  I have never been brand loyal before.  I have pretty average combination skin: maybe get a pimple or two once a month, slightly oily in the T zone and slightly dry everywhere else.  I have used everything from expensive department store brands, high end luxury products, to Wal-Mart's finest (as well as their cheapest).  I've never found anything I really got too excited about.  I went to an open house at a local spa and in their gift bag they included a full sized bottle of Image Vital C cleanser.  I tried it that night and immediately fell in love with the light citrus scent.  Even my husband who is very sensitive to smell and generally doesn't like anything scented commented that it smelled really great.  I continued using it for a couple of weeks and loved how soft and smooth my skin was.  My combination skin was less dramatic - the oily zone not quite as oily and the dry zones not quite as dry.  Nice!  I wasn't breaking out - but I don't do that often anyway.  Then, a couple of months later I had an extreme reaction to a prescription and ended up with a large area of my face being overcome with a tissue killing rash and in many places blistering and turning into huge open wounds.  It looked like a handful of acid had wrapped around my face, ear and neck.  It was awful.  As I recovered the Vital C was the perfect thing to keep the area clean and yet not burn or hurt when it touched the broken, healing skin.  It claims to be good for post-surgical skin, and I give it a bit of credit for having minimal scarring.  I am fair skinned and heavily freckled, so the new tissue is very noticeable still (8 months later) - but only because it doesn't have any freckles.  The skin is nice and firm and healthy and not red or puckered or scarred.  I just hope the freckles fill in over time - but I can't count on any product to do that!  I'm now a loyal Vital C user.  I buy it in the spa sized bottle when the deal is right because I know this is the only thing I want to use summer and winter.  I love it! The foam feels fresh and hydration even while it cleanses. Trust me it'll make your skin so incredibly smooth and pimple free. This is the first review I've ever written on a product I've purchased from Amazon.  Often, if a product is no good, I just won't purchase it again and move on with my life.  If a product is satisfactory or good, I'll (selfishly and lazily) keep it to myself.I'm coming down to the end of my fourth bottle since May of 2011.  I LOVE THIS STUFF!  It is is the _greatest_ face wash I've ever used.  So of course I was compelled to write a review.I started getting acne about 10 years ago when I hit my 20s - and it got progressively worse until I was about 24, until it kind of mellowed out - due largely to prescription Accutane. However, I would always consistently have a few bad acne spots on my face - real tough, painful SOBs - but nothing where it could be classified as me having "bad acne" - just bad skin, which I decided to just live with.Anyhow, since I started dealing with acne I've tried Accutane (settled it down, but didn't solve the problem), benzoyl peroxide, differin gel, Vitamin-A acid, pro-activ (the most useless product I tried - total bait-n-switch - but that's what late-night infomercials are for), clindamycin gel (quite good, actually - but only available with a Rx which becomes a pain to constantly have to get), cetaphil, and other stuff, including something from a tall, green bottle that literally looks like a milky, male-produced bodily fluid ('nuff said)  - and this, the Neutrogena Acne Stress Control *scrub* (the power foam wash is useless for me) works THE best.What's great about the scrub is that the beads "scrub" away the dead skin cells, while the active ingredient cleans your skin, and the moisturizing agent ensures that your skin doesn't dry out afterwards.My mother-in-law uses this product, and when I was visiting my in-laws in Michigan, I got a hold of it because I had run out of Cetaphil that morning.  I used it without any presumption that it would work or be beneficial - because every Salicylic Acid product has actually worsened and burned my skin (but hey, I needed a face wash that morning).My acne will usually develop over the course of a day, largely based on the amount of stress I'm placed under (I'm a trial attorney, and some days I'm a zit machine), and this product worked like a charm - in spite of the in-laws and all.  No new acne on the first day, and on subsequent days, the existing acne was counter-acted and reduced quicker than even the Clindamycin gel could ever do (which again, is quite good - but does take much, much, much longer for results - which come inevitably).If you're in the market for a new face wash/scrub, definitely give this a shot.  It's literally taken me 10 years to find this product - but it's worth every penny. This product is amazing. This product was a life saver, and is great for people without acne who need a little breakout control. My skin has bounced from oily to sort dry and sorta oily to combination and back again. I tried every type of product out there from OTC to expensive to prescription to altering my diet, but all to no avail. As a teen, I thought I was stuck with it forever. This didn't change from my teens to early twenties. I usually used makeup to hide the acne and scars that but it was always too heavy and had too many chemicals in it, which didn't let my skin breath. For a while, I was using Proactiv, which sort of worked but sporadically. By my mid-twenties, its effects were no longer effective and in fact, made my adult acne worse!I realized that part of my problem, since the beginning of my acne woes, was that I was trying new acne treatments every month, not giving a product enough time to do its magic when I wanted instant results, which will NEVER happen with any product, no matter what they advertise or the strength. Back then, the selection was very limited and they were usually either too strong, or not strong enough. What I did was that I ended up messing up my skin by choosing harsh formulas that stripped my skin, which only produced more oil, which attracted grime and bacteria, clogging up pores, and encouraged acne. I also knew that my skin probably got accustomed to one treatment and lost its effect, for whatever reason because it'd work for a while, then all of a sudden, I'd be breaking out. The only good thing out of the Proactiv industry was that it prompted other companies to follow a similar formula of a three-step system.Neutrogena was one of them. When I quit Proactiv five years ago and started experimenting with the newer products, I'd give it a good 6-8 months then try something else, all OTC. By that time, my skin's oil levels had reduced a bit and my acne came and went, regardless of any product I used. A couple of years ago, I came across Neutrogena's Acne Stress Control line and at six bucks at Target or any store, it's so friendly to the wallet. Keep in mind, many of these acne products ARE gimmicks but a few are gems, and Neutrogena has is now my must have and for several years. At first, the gentle microbead formula felt too scratchy against my skin but I kept using it and after the first week, I remember seeing how it cleared up  my skin. I was truly surprised but didn't get my hopes up too much. The first week or so, it's sometimes that bliss week and then it all goes downhill. But I kept using it and it was, gasp!, working. Every week, I saw fewer and fewer zits and if they did appear, they weren't big, just a tiny dot or two that went away a few days later and easily hidden with makeup. I was only using the scrub, but I found that the acne STAYS away when I use Neutrogena Oil Free Acne Stress Control Triple Action Toner, 8 Ounce after I wash my face. Every couple of days, after the toner, I use the Neutrogena All-in-1 Acne Control Treatment, 1 Ounce, which makes it very similar to the Proactiv system, but this combo is truly more effective. The entire 3 system costs less than 20 bucks and lasts for quite a while. After two years, I won't use anything else.The color is that pale moss green you see through the container, with little microbeads that massages your skin. There's hardly any smell. It's really gentle (but powerful!) and doesn't over dry and my skin has felt smoother and softer since I've been using it. I use it every morning and every night. I wet my face with LUKEWARM water (not hot as that can actually irritate the skin by breaking capillaries, small blood vessels just under the skin), use a dime-sized amount and make circular motion and spread it all over, rubbing it into my skin for a good minute. One bottle lasts me about 2-3 months and I keep them in stock in my bathroom closet. No way am I running out!The best advice I can give for oily-faced women is not touching your face constantly, sleeping on your back so the dirt/oils on the pillow don't get on your skin, not picking at that zit that might pop up and since I also have oily hair, keeping it off my face as much as possible. Choose a scrub, any kind you want, that will EXFOLIATE your skin and get rid of dead cells lying on top of the skin. Moisturize-MOISTURIZE-moisturize! Most importantly, everything must be OIL-FREE or made for OILY SKIN, that included your face scrub to your moisturizer to makeup--Everything. Now a days, there cost effective products that work and for all skin types and you can even find Salicylic Acid (the main chemical that fights acne and helps to reduce dark spots) in makeup, which I use, that is gentle and not aggressive. In the end, let the product work and be patient, but persistent! great product I have cystic acne.  This product has helped me so much in taming the breakouts. I love this product after my first few days of use.But before I go into complimenting how good it is, I warn everyone for improper use. When they write apply to entire "affected area", they mean it literally. Try to avoid areas around EYE as much as possible, because the skin there is much thinner. If the acne is near your eye, make sure you restrict the product to the point of acne. Also, it may be wise to avoid apply to area of open wound until the lesion heals. And just a tip in general, do not touch/squeeze/pop your acne unless you know what you're doing. 90% of the time you will only make it worse, and an irreversible acne scar may result.Excessive drying will occur and it is likely caused by one of the unlabeled active ingredients in the toner (?). This ingredient "eats away" your top layer of skin, allowing salicylic acid to stimulate efficient skin turnover. You want to use apply the toner using a cotton ball, or else you will notice your palm skin flakes and sheds.Irritation will happen at the area you apply, and it's normal. Like I said, an ingredient eats away some old skins, causing the irritation. HOWEVER, pay attention to the irritation spots. If your skin loses elasticity or have excessive drying (esp around eyes), stop apply on the area and cover it with a good moisturizer. Once the skin is hydrated, the irritation should go away. If not, don't use it anymore and consult your doctor.Some people commented this products not working for them or stop working after a while. Most likely, they have tolerance for the ingredients or develop tolerance over time. Too bad for these people. They have to figure out other products that will work for them.I will follow up if my acnes all clear, or if I become one of those unlucky tolerant people. I love this acne set. My experience with the Art Naturals Dead Sea Mask was nothing short of amazing.  The mask was cool on my face and didn't tingle or burn or cause any itching.  I set a timer for 15 minutes and once the 15 minutes was up, I began the removal process.  Typically, I would just use warm water to remove the mask, but with the dead sea mask, the instructions actually state to remove the mask by massaging the face in circular motions.  The mask began to fall off, exfoliating the skin during the process.  Public Service Announcement:  This process can create quite the mess in the sink!  I removed as much of the mask as I could and then used luke warm water to remove the remaining mask around my eyebrows and hairline.I couldn't believe how great my skin felt! Works great works well Five stars excelente I've been looking for a nice mud mask, because my skin has been acting up and also because I'm severely oily (when I say "severely," I mean that I can do my makeup, walk out the door immediately after, and by the time I get to my car, I already see the "shine" coming through. And by lunch time, fuggedaboutit!).As with all of my Amazon purchases, I decided to do some research. After filtering through the products and reading all sorts of reviews, I decided to give this dead sea mud mask a shot. My skin isn't particularly sensitive, meaning it doesn't react or flare up with most new products (although, do keep in mind that I don't use just any ol' products on my face, either), so I figured this might be a good buy.I was so excited to get this in the mail. I mean, we all get antsy and excited for that brown box to arrive at our doorsteps, but this one, I was particularly excited about. As soon as it came, I tore through the box like a crazy lady, and sat it down on my vanity as I sprinted into my bathroom to wash my face. When I got back to my vanity, I switched on the light on my mirror (one that I bought years and years ago at a Costco and can't seem to find online..) and went to town! I made sure to apply a nice, thick, even layer of this mask all over my face, and joined the hubs and puppies on the couch for some Netflix.At first, my skin felt a little tingly. I attributed that to the fact that my skin was probably dry from not applying any toner or moisturizer to it after washing up. The tingly sensations were gone pretty quickly, and I could comfortably relax with the mask on. As it dried, I patted my forehead and cheeks once in a while to see if it was all dry. Once I saw and felt that it had dried up completely, I went back to the bathroom to wash it off. Even washing it off felt nice! As you wet the mask again to wash it off, it turns back into this creamy texture that feels wonderful on your skin. I made sure to use warm water and to get every little bit off, before I pat-dried my face. When I turned to the mirror to apply my toner and moisturizer..HOLY COW. My skin hadn't been that soft since I was in diapers! I was so amazed with how soft and smooth my skin felt, that I couldn't help but to touch my cheeks again and again. I applied my toner and moisturizer, then ran over to the hubs to tell him to feel, too. Days after my first try, my skin still feels softer, my blemishes have faded a bit, and call me crazy, but my pores already look a bit smaller! It hasn't seemed to help with the issue of oiliness, but that's just something I'm going to have to work on little by little.If you aren't sure which mud mask to try out, PICK THIS ONE!!! Give it a shot, feel your skin, and never look back.** TIP: when applying this mask, make sure you put on a t-shirt that you don't care to get dirty! Because I had applied it to my face and upper neck like it says to do, washing it off meant that the muddy water dripped down my neck and got onto my shirt. It was a beat up black t-shirt, courtesy of my hubs, so I was fine, but it's definitely something to keep in mind!If my review has helped you in any way, please let me know, or hit "Yes" under this review. Thank you! :) Unlike another Dead Sea Mud by another brand, this one looks and feels like real mud:  thick texture, but applies smoothly and a little goes a long way.  I use a clean plastic spoon to avoid contamination.  The first spoonful covered my face, neck and backs of my hands with a solid layer. Next time used half as much--closer to a level teaspoon.  One container will provide dozens of applications. It dried pleasantly and left my skin feeling very soft, but I still followed up with a serum and moisturizer.  Caution:  this mud is VERY thick and it is easy to get it onto everything you touch.  Wear something easy to wash. Use just your hands to wash off the mud; I do it in the shower. Great price and arrived I am pretty sure the Very next day after ordering. Ill be purchasing more in the near future!! The Dead Sea is an amazing place. It’s a tiny body of water nestled between Israel and Jordan. Despite its size, it’s unique because it’s the lowest place on Earth, and it’s so salty that you’ll float without even trying. The landscape of the sea causes numerous minerals and substances to be deposited into the sea. It eventually washes ashore to the sea’s bank providing a rich mud that is filled with natural goodness.These fascinating features have given the sea an aura that is attractive to many people. Tourists come from far and wide to get a chance to soak in these healing waters and slather the mud on their skin.Many companies extract the mud from the sea and package it into a convenient product. While the mud is great to lather on your body, it’s most convenient to use as a mask.  This product is the best of the bunch.  Price and quality is better than any other product on the market!!!!There are a ton of reasons why you must get your hands on Dead Sea mud. Here are a few of the top reasons:Benefits of Dead Sea MudDead Sea mud is rich in a variety of minerals, salts and other powerful substances. These include magnesium, potassium, sodium and calcium. This powerful blend of nutrients does wonders for the skin including:• Improves Complexion: The powerful nutrients in the Dead Sea mask help to shrink pores, reduce the appearance of lines and wrinkles, and help to draw out the toxins from your pores. It also helps to clear dead skin cells, leaving your skin clearer and brighter.• Reduces the Appearance of Cellulite: It provides good blood circulation and relaxes the skin.Remedy’s Skin Conditions: These conditions include psoriasis, eczema and acne.• Moisturizes Skin: It can help promote a healthy balance of oil production.• Prevents Aging: This mud has the power to tighten and firm sagging skin by promoting strong elasticity.• Gets Rid of Impurities: The masks work to unclog pores and to help purge your skin of any residues leaving you with fresher, younger looking skin.Those are some pretty powerful benefits!In fact, the healing power of the Dead Sea is so profound that many people travel there to treat a variety of health ailments including arthritis and allergies. But for now we are just focusing on the amazing benefits for skin, specifically through facial masks. When you have sensitive skin or allergies to chemicals and fragrance it can be frustrating to find a safe and effective product. Fear not; this facial cleanser is the perfect one for you! This cleanser is free of dyes, parabens, lanolin, fragrance, masking fragrance, oils, formaldehyde, amines, gluten, sodium lauryl sulfate and soap; so, you can be sure those harsh chemicals that should not be on your face, stay off your face. Whether you are looking for a cleanser to clear acne, wash away the day’s makeup, or simply leave you feeling refreshed, this cleanser will not disappoint. I only recently learned of my allergy to fragrance and I was concerned I would not be able to find a product that could so easily replace my existing cleanser, but this cleanser has proved to rank above all others in quality, smell, and usability.QUALITYThis facial cleanser sells for $8.99 for an 8-ounce bottle, which is a little more expensive than comparable products, but is worth the couple extra dollars for the quality of the product. Vanicream facial cleanser is gentle and effective, and does not dry out the skin; therefore, you can be confident that it is safe for everyday use. Vanicream offers you the most “bang for your buck”; a little goes a long way, so even though this bottle may be slighter smaller than average, it will last you a long time. I have used this cleanser twice a day, every day for three weeks and still have three-fourths of the bottle remaining.Vanicream facial cleanser offers a degree of quality that is hard to find elsewhere in a cleanser, so I would recommend this product even to those who are not chemical or skin sensitive!SMELLThis product is advertised as fragrance-free, but it does have a soft scent to it; Vanicream facial cleanser smells clean, similar to baby powder. However, you can rest easy knowing that this facial cleanser does not get its scent from harsh, flower and fruit scented chemicals, that could potentially irritate your eyes and skin.USABILITYPerhaps the most important feature of Vanicream facial cleanser is that it is easy and convenient to use. The 8-ounce bottle is outfitted with a pump that never seems to get clogged or “gunked up.” Washing your face with Vanicream facial cleanser is a simple step process, unlike some other fragrance-free lines. It works best to wet your hands and face with warm water beforehand, and then lather the product in your hands before applying to your face. Once applied, it is easy to rinse the product off with warm water once again; this process will leave you and your face feeling clean and refreshed.The product is not too goopy and it transforms into the perfect foamy consistency.This is the perfect product to help you wash away the dirt of the day in the evening AND to help you wake up in the morning. I would recommend this product to absolutely anyone seeking an alternative to chemical-laden facial cleansers, and this is a MUST HAVE for anyone with a skin sensitivity or chemical allergy. My skin gets really soft and I've noticed my blemishes fade away.  Awesome product! I started really taking care of my skin when I started Cosmetology school at the age of 15. At 44, to say I've tried dozens of masks is if anything, an understatement. I had and still have combination/oily skin and so have always used pore refining or clay masks. While they've had different gimmicks over the years, with this or that "new" thing being added, in essence they've all been about the same. Clay or "mud" masks thatabsorb excess oil from pores and help to dry up existing acne. Some were a bit tingly from mint and others a bit stingy from any number of contributors, ie. alcohols, acids, and/or fragrances. Some were so drying they left my skin feeling like the Sahara and some did absolutely nothing and were totally pointless. My point is, in over 30 years of masking, not a single one has really stood apart from the rest. Until now. THIS mask is in a class all its own! Immediately, as soon as you scoop some out and begin to apply it your skin, you feel something "different". To put a finer point on it, I'd have to say it feels really, REALLY smooth. No burning, stinging on tingling. As strange as this is going to sound, it's absolutely true ... it feels HYDRATING. And while it sits on the skin hydrating it, it's also pulling oil out of the pores like crazy! Something else I noticed; you know how with a typical "mud" mask, when the oil comes out of the pores you get the little dark colored dots where the oil's been absorbed by the mud? With this mask, the oil pools on top. The mud doesn't absorb the oil, it wicks it out to the surface. Not only is this a really cool thing to witness (lol) but since the mud isn't saturated there's no limit to the amount of oil it can absorb. I'm always so fascinated by the amount of oil being drawn out that I'll sit in front of a mirror with a tissue and blot the pools as they form only to watch another form in its place and blot again. I know that sounds crazy but when you have super oily skin it's really satisfying! Then after all that oil comes out you'd think you'd be dry as a bone but it's just the opposite, your face feels baby soft and smooth, not at ALL greasy. There's no residue at all. This is the only mask I've ever used that does two things at once; absorbs and hydrates. NOT ABORTED FETAL CELLS!! I am an authorized seller of neocutis, although I do not sell on Amazon.  I have read multiple inaccurate reviews talking about it being made by aborted fetal cells.  This product was developed in Switzerland and initially was not researched for cosmetics.  However researchers with the university of Switzerland were studying collagen type 3 which is in abundance prior to 24 weeks gestation, and essentially gone at birth.  A patient miscarried at about 10 weeks.  The fetus in question was incompatible with life.  She did not abort, but miscarried.  However she didn't pass the products of conception on her own and had to have a D&C.  She was asked if she wanted the products, wanted them to be destroyed, or wanted to donate them to science and research.  She chose to donate them.  They were studied and collagen 3, as well as other growth factors, fibroblasts, and Interleukins were extracted.  As is commonly done these cells were placed on auger plates or growth medium to replicate and grow.  Some of the researchers eventually branched out and created neocutis using these harvested cells.  Like other cells they will replicate using the right auger (remember bio 101?!).  The auger medium alone contains no human growth factor.  That is still what is used to make PSP.  They do not use "aborted fetal cells".  What is used is cells donated for research and development from one sad, but natural occurrence.  It has been made into hospital cream for wound healing, post skin graft, and burn healing amongst other dermatologic uses including aesthetics.  Do yourself a favor and stop perpetuating inaccurate, false information and do your research. My skin has been wonderful since I started using this cream and it has sunscreen. Well, the first thing I did was buy a pH kit (SEOH O14) and tested every single product I'd been using. Hair stuff was 7 to 9 pH, no wonder it was so dry, but the worst was the "natural, organic" soap I was using on my face that came in at a whopping 9.0 pH. Omigosh! And bleach is 12pH! No wonder my face was such a mess.  So, I read the reviews on this product and this was 5.5 pH (oh and beware of products which say they are pH 'balanced' - that simply means the pH is 7.0). I recently began a quest for all the beauty products needed to achieve the youthful, dewy look ever popular in Korea in anticipation of my wedding day. (Yes, I'm an American who watches a lot of Kdramas and became supremely jealous of Kon Joon-He's character in "She Was Pretty.") I've had a fantastic experience with the new skin care regimen: huge reduction in blemishes, almost completely eliminated the pimples!!!--I just get one or two during my period--evened skin tone, and overall a cleaner, softer face. Since it's been so overwhelming to research every step on my own, I'm providing a list of all the winners so far, and in what order of the skin care/makeup routine to use them in. Hopefully this is helpful for anyone who wants to venture into the world of Korean skin care but isn't sure where to start. **Indicates the product in review.1. Cleanser - The Face Shop: Rice Water Bright**Apply this to dry, unwashed skin and gently rub in circles to fully cleanse your face. Works as a makeup remover, but I'd recommend a different product for eye makeup removal. Rinse the oil off with lukewarm water. This is the perfect, gentle cleanser for sensitive, mixed oily/dry skin, like mine. It has a very faint smell of rice water. Not surprising, considering that's what it is. A little goes a long way, so one pump is usually enough for my entire face. Be careful not to carry it sideways in a makeup kit if the pump gets loose. I made the mistake of doing that, and got all my other products coated in rice water cleanser. ;) Oh, and that little plastic thing on the pump pops right off. It took me forever to figure it out. I kept twisting and unscrewing and finally realised you just pull the little plastic piece right off and then snap it back on when you're done for the night. :P2. Toner/Refresher - Etude House 10-in-1 House Wonder Pore FreshenerTightens pores, and purifies skin. Apply to a cotton pad or cotton balls and then to face. Let dry.3. Moisturiser - Skin Food Peach Sake EmulsionPretty self-explanatory. Apply right after the toner sets in to feed your face with some moisture.4. Serum - Skin Food Peach Sake Pore SerumA slightly more concentrated moisturiser to apply after the first. Yes, Koreans have many steps (most of them moisturising ones) in their beauty routine, I've learned. But it really does amazing things to your skin. And once you get the hang of it, applying all these products every night doesn't really take a whole lot of extra time. It also cuts back on my makeup routine in the morning, because when my skin is naturally healthy, clear, and soft, I'd rather show it off than cover it up. ;)5. Night Cream - Nature Republic Fresh Green TeaNOTE: This particular product is not sold on Amazon. I had to buy it on sale at my local Korean market because I was too scared to order anything over $10 that I wasn't sure about. But you can find any number of night creams here for the final step. I recommend something with green tea or aloe. Just apply at night onto clean, pampered skin, rub it in thoroughly, and sleep on it!Other Cosmetics/Extras I Found Useful/Worth Purchasing:Facial Scrub - Skin Food Black Sugar MaskUse twice a week for a deeper facial cleanse than you regular cleanser. Apply a little, gently exfoliate, leave on, rinse off. If it goes on too thick, use a little water or toner to make it easier to scrub in.CC Cream - Lioele Dollish CC Cera-VCC Creams are much like BB Creams, (not a cream to match your skin colour, but a transparent foundation/primer) but if my experience with the two I've tried is any indication, CC Creams give more coverage and make the skin look more bright, white, and luminescent, rather than simply evening out the skin tone and providing SPF. Apply before any colour foundations.Highlighter - Etude House Secret Beam Highlighter #1 Pink & White MixTo be brushed on over foundation in key spots to brighten the face even further. Goes on like a sheer fairy dust--just a bit of sparkle, but not like glitter. This isn't for a Labyrinth Masquerade ball, you know. ;)Face Mist - Innisfree Green Tea Mineral MistFace Mist is something you apply whenever you choose, before or after makeup, to keep your face hydrated and fresh throughout the day. I carry a bottle in my purse and spritz a little on whenever I feel my face is tired. :) This particular mist I haven't tried yet, because my order hasn't arrived, but I bought a Nature Republic bamboo mist from my local Korean market, and I love it a lot.Products I Didn't Think Worth the Fuss:Face Masks- These are a huge hit in Korea, and they're fun to wear around the house to get a rise out of family members who think you look creepy. But for me they're too sticky, drippy, and overrated. I prefer the clay masks or avocado masks that you have to wash off after.Expensive Serums, Essence, Bee Toxin... anything over $20 a bottle I passed up. As I've discovered, you can get really great results with just the five things I listed above, and none of them are over $15. Most are under $10. Very impressed with this oil. The first time I used it was right after I got out of the shower, my face was clean...or so I thought. I applied the oil just to give it a try. A tiny squirt that I rubbed onto my fingers to easily distribute onto my face. The oil is light and had a soft scent that I'd describe as powdery with a hint of flowers. I massaged the oil in a circular motion onto my face and later removed it with a cotton ball, and to my amazement the cotton ball was dirty, ew! Mind you, I had not been using any makeup that day. This oil picked up dirt (most likely dead skin) that I didn't know was there! That's also why I use a cotton ball, so I can see what I've picked up. I later applied water to rinse off what was left of the oil and later washed my face again with a Korean brand of face soap that I ordered along with this oil. My face felt fresh and clean without any tightness or dryness. My skin type is: combination with an oily t-zone. I've been using this for several days now and it removes makeup so well. I just put a pump or two onto my fingers and massage the oil all over my face, concentrating on the areas where I applied makeup, remove the oil with a cotton ball, rinse my face with water, then apply face soap ( just started using a Korean brand) because I like to make sure everything is thoroughly clean. Just to let you know, the oil is light and watery. I would say that it's a dry oil and doesn't really leave you greasy like oils do (I can't read Korean so not sure if they would call it a dry oil, but it sure does feel that way). The name of this cleanser grabbed my attention immediately; I was intrigued, and wanted to know exactly what "gel melt cleanser" would do, and how well it would get the job done. Its a clear, thick gel that has no fragrance, which is excellent news for people with sensitive skin. It works just like traditional oil cleansing, with no foaming or lathering agents, which is excellent news for people with dry skin. And it rinses clean, taking makeup and dirt with it without stripping any moisture from your skin. Which is excellent news for everyone!  I've been using oil cleansers on my face for several years and I really love how well the clean away dirt and impurities without drying out my skin. I've tried many different brands from both ends of the cost spectrum, but I've never seen one like this. The thick gel stays wherever you put it until you start massaging it into the skin; then the warmth and friction make it melt into an oil. Once you've massaged it all over your face you add a little bit of warm water and massage again, which emulsifies the oil into a white, foam-free lather that rinses away clean with just water. No oily residue is left behind at all, just clean, baby-soft skin. Younger people or those with oily skin may feel the need to follow with a very gently foaming cleanser if their skin feels greasy after, but I don't think its necessary at all. This is my favorite new way to remove makeup at night in one step (although I don't use it for eye makeup removal, but only because I've always just used baby oil and a cotton ball and nothing works better. Nothing).  This is definitely worth a shot if you're curious about oil cleansing, or if you've tried it but hate how messy it can be because its impossible to control the oil running down your face and through your fingers. This gel isn't going anywhere until you want it to.  Two very enthusiastic thumbs up! Normally, I wait at least a month to review a product, but I'm so astounded with this product that I have to review after using it ONCE! Let me start by saying that I have combination skin. I have extremely dry skin around my mouth and oily skin on my cheeks and nose with large pores. I've tried many products for combination skin, but like EVERY other product out there, it either leaves my cheeks greasy or around my mouth dry. My main issue is my large pores that are very noticeable.My skin routine consists of washing my cheeks, forehead and nose with a pore refining exfoliator. Then use a wash cloth to scrub my nose because it's prone to black heads. I avoid washing around my mouth with anything other than water because it's so dry. When I dry my face, I'll scrub lightly on my nose again with a towel. I then use toner on my cheeks, nose and forehead, again avoiding around my mouth. Then I moisturize my face. After that, I moisturize around my mouth again and sometimes put lotion on that spot if it's still too dry. After letting it dry, I'll put on makeup.Now that you know the crazy routine I go through, let me tell you that the only thing I changed was the exfoliator. I didn't realize this when I bought it, but this is not made with soap. I have shampoo like that for my pets (soap-less shampoo) but it never even crossed my mind that they can do that with cleansers and exfoliators. I thought it was perfect, I NEED something that doesn't have soap! This time I washed my entire face with this.I have never felt my face so clean before! I mean, I do at home facials and use masks, but I have never felt it like THIS! Usually after washing my face, I can feel right away that around my mouth is dry. I didn't feel that this time, at least not nearly as badly. I also didn't feel the need to scrub my nose with the towel. I did the toner, as usual. This time when I moisturized, I only had to do around my mouth ONCE! And my cheeks didn't look greasy, like it actually did the day before. My skin was so even, it was glowing. It improved the appearance of my pores so much that if I didn't know better, I would've thought I was wearing makeup. I actually sat there and stared at my skin because I couldn't believe the transformation of my pores. Seriously, I went from orange peel to almost normal.I'm so impressed with this product, it's almost like they made it specifically with me in mind. I couldn't dream of anything more perfect for my skin. I actually forgot how much I paid for it and saw that I actually pay just as much for my other exfoliator that is specifically intended to improve the appearance of pores. That exfoliator does a fraction of the performance this does. And it smells so good! I couldn't recommend this more for people with large pores and combination skin! I am 46 and still have acne. I am allergic to acne products containing salicylic acid (which is most of them!). Due to my age, I also need a cleanser that is hydrating. I am so grateful that I have found this product! I use it everyday and finally my skin is clear and soft. The exfoliating apricot seeds are very small and fine. They do not irritate my skin compared to other cleansers such as St. Ives. In addition, the cleanser is somehow non-greasy, although it contains a variety of oils. Now that I know Amazon sells this product at such a reasonable price, I will be purchasing it here from now on. I hope this review has been helpful to others who suffer with adult acne. It's refreshing to see this new line of skincare emerge from a market that is currently oversaturated with brands touting themselves as "all-natural" or "clean". I'm consistently a shameless consumer of such brands (hey, how do you know until you've tried it?!), but I'm happy to say that Tula may actually be one of the few that are true to their word - with results to prove it. This particular set has a few perks - it's travel-friendly (perfect for a quick weekender trip), the bright packaging and logo is sleek and minimal (yes, I'm also a sucker for packaging), perfect for a trial test run of the Tula  brand, before you commit to the normal sized products, smell is fragrant enough, without being too overpowering - but my favorite part is how each product absorbs and transforms the skin. I've yet to find a line of skincare that feels like it's working, without feeling/looking overly greasy and oily, especially as I've gone from normal to oily combination skin with age. From the cleanser, wrinkle serum, eye cream, and day/night cream, everything in this set goes on light, weightless, and leaves you with a dewy, soft glow. Only downside is how quickly I'll fly through this set. For the last few months, I have been hearing friends talk about TULA and finally decided to take the plunge when I saw this set. I am 26 years old and have recently noticed that my skin is changing. Any moisturizer used to be fine for keeping my dry skin relatively hydrated all day, but recently I have noticed that the moisture isn't sticking around very long on my skin. It felt like every few hours I would need to reapply, and the increased dryness is making my fine lines more prominent. I tried the TULA set, and I am very impressed with the line. The moisturizer is my favorite. My skin looks so glowy (but not greasy) when I put it on and the radiance stays. I don't need to reapply after a few hours. I also have enjoyed layering the serum under the moisturizer to help disguise some of my fine lines that have been becoming more visible due to dryness. The eye cream absorbs quickly, and makes it so that my fine lines around my eyes are staying moisturized. The face wash was fun to try, but I didn't love it as much as I loved the other three products. Overall, I give TULA  5/5. Their products did what they said they were going to do. I have tried the black tea mash from fresh I loved it so much but the price is too much, this one's feeling texture and smell almost same as it, but price only 1/10 The Burt's Bees Sensitive facial cleanser is an excellent product that delivers.ABOUT: According to the packaging, this product is in the "Sensitive" skincare line and offers a "natural skin solution" that "moisturizes without causing redness or irritation". It is also "soap-free, fragrance-free, and hypo-allergenic". The bottle boasts the ability to "soften, moisturize, and soothe".REVIEW: I decided to review this product because I am disappointed in the current reviews.  Too many times have people mentioned that they would rate this higher if it offered anti-acne medication and/or some type of aging-deterrent. People! Why not review the product for how it performs with the actual claims on the bottle? Specifically - soften, moisturize, and soothe.  I have been using this product for three weeks now. I have acne-prone skin that is very sensitive because of several topical medications that I am on which address this acne-prone skin. For me, the "holy grail" of facial cleansers is a product that is gentle enough to not irritate my skin, but still effective as a cleansing agent. Does not cause break-outs. Oh, yeah - and please add a moisturizing component and an aesthetic experience. With these requirements, let's just say I've been around the block a few times with cleansers - from department stores (Clinique) to drug stores (everything!).  This cleanser is the best that I have used! I love the creamy consistency, which gently removes makeup, dirt, grime, and grease while still leaving my skin feeling moisturized. It does not form a gross suds-ball because it isn't full of unnecessary and irritating surfactants/detergents. It doesn't cause breakouts, and while unscented, it has a very faint "toasted rice" scent to it, which may be the Rice extract. I noticed that a few reviewers commented on the "film" that it left on their face - honey, those are your natural oils! I agree that I also felt a little "filmy" after I first used it, but by the next wash that sensation went away - replaced by a thrill of not having to rush for my moisturizer within 30 seconds to replace all the oils I just stripped away. It's quite nice!  In summary, this facial cleanser delivers. If you are looking for an anti-aging or anti-acne cleanser, this is NOT it. If you are looking for a cleanser that will clean and moisturize your sensitive skin, I don't know that you will find a better product than this one. By the way, it's 99.0% natural - that's pretty great, too! Since started using this product, my skin is seriously improved. Turns out soap makes me break-out, so I'm now a soap-free gal. My wife and I use this daily. Cleans gently without any sting, and with no fragrance. We think it's great. Purchased this locally to give it a try. But this doesn't further irritate my skin, it doesn't make it even redder after using it, it doesn't burn, it doesn't itch, it doesn't dry me out or make my skin even oily-er, and it actually visibly works. After I used it that first night, by the morning the pimple was completely gone already with no irritation left behind. I'm amazed at how healthy my skin is now. Lol, have I said that enough? I don't know what type of makeup they're using, but it's been up to the task for me and does remove it. But now I may not even need to wear makeup anymore (that would be awesome!). The cleanser is very thick. I splash water on my face before I apply to help with that. I gently rub it into my face in small circles and leave it on for maybe a minute without touching it, before applying more water and gently rubbing it further in. Love this product. Feels great on the face,cleans and leaves a nice scent. I only use one other face soap, an orange one by Neutrogena with salicylic acid in it.  Actually that is the soap I used to use before I was lucky enough to receive a sample of this Mr. Smith face soap to review.My old soap is great, it works great, but it tends to be too harsh and leave my face dry and flaky.  It is not a bad soap, but after using this Mr. Smith face cleaner I am going to switch brands.The best thing about this soap is that it is really gentle.  It does not dry out my face at all.  However it still does a great job of cleaning my skin.  I used to think that you needed a harsh soap to get a good clean face.  Apparently that is not the case.The soap smells light and pleasant.  I don't want to smell like fifteen different products when I come out of the bathroom every morning, so I really appreciate that this soap does not leave any smell or fragrance behind.  The smell while washing is nice and very light.The soap itself is pretty thick but comes out of the bottle easily.  The opening seems to be just the right size so that I am not getting too much or too little product when I use it.  It goes on easily and spreads and lathers nicely.  The sandy beads seem to scrub the skin but I am not sure how much difference this makes as I don't usually use any sort of face scrubbing product.  It washes off easily and does not leave any residue.The bead material seems to be made of nut shells.  This is great because a friend told me that the plastic beads in similar products end up in the ocean and are generally an environmental menace.  I am not sure what the impact is because I have not seen any articles on the topic, however I like that this product might be better for the environment compared to competing products as organic matter should degrade much faster in the environment compared to plastic.The bottle is quite large at the 8 oz size.  I don't mean that it won't fit in my bathroom; I keep it in the shower on a shelf.  It is big because with the small amount needed to wash my face I think that this bottle will last a very long time.The ingredients seem to be high quality but I am not really familiar with any of them.  While the product does do a good job of cleaning my face I can't yet say whether or not it has any anti-aging properties. Allot of people could use this product alone to stop breakouts if they have moderate adult acne but people with bigger adult acne problems should really try this product and Oxy Maximum Daily Face Wash along with controlling or eliminating processed sugars in their diet before resorting to a Dermatologist. I have spent ALLOT of money on Dermatologist appointments, medications (which often damage the liver), and the MD's brand of acne wash - all of which did little more in the long term than damage to my body and wallet.My first hand recommendation for moderate to severe adult acne. While in the shower, use this product, rinse, then use Oxy Maximum Daily Face Wash w/ 10% Benzoyl Peroxide (same amount of BP as the MD wash) and rinse. If starting during a severe breakout, perform 2x per day but no more (because of skin drying). You should see results within 2-3 days and clear skin within 1-4 weeks (depending on severity of the infection). Finally, listen to your body before listening to the flip/flop notion that diet doesn't play a part in acne - certain refined/processed sugars (usually from desserts and candy) provoke skin secretions that initiate and worsen acne. Was the right thing for my chemo skin... lovely cleansing oil, smells great and feels good (and cleans also) I recently purchased this face cleansing oil along with the post-cleansing Badger Damascus Rose Face Oil for moisturizing. With spot treatment and no picking on my part, they went away quickly and never got out of hand. Easily covered with concealer. I think this may have also just been expected since starting this routine would by default start drawing impurities to the surface. I have struggled with hormonal adult acne on/off for the last several years. I've tried everything to help with it but struggled to find something to consistently kept the breakouts at bay. Several months ago, I read that oil facial cleansing can actually help eliminate acne due to how much better it cleanses the skin. Since the oil in the cleanser is attracted to the sebum in your skin, the impurities in your sebum are brought to the surface and wiped away with the oil cleanser and a warm face cloth. Just like we learned in science class, 'like attracts like'. I don't know what took me so long to connect these dots! My face feels DEEPLY cleansed when I'm done washing my face, and yet the process is much more gentle on your skin.Admittedly, I was skeptical and fearful the oil may break me out more. I tried using coconut oil as a cleanser before buying this product, but eventually noticed my skin was breaking out even worse. I did some additional research and read that coconut oil has excellent properties for the skin, but is more comodogenic than other oils. This oil cleanser has a variety of oils that I've read online are the best options for face cleansing. It does not contain coconut oil.  If you're worried about breakouts, don't be.Here's the routine I've been following:- Squirt 2-4 pumps of oil into my palms and rub the oil a bit in my palms before applying to my DRY face, neck, and chest area. How many pumps depends on how much makeup I wore and if I applied mascara that day. It removes mascara very easily, too.- Let the oil rest on your face while the water is warming up. Soak a wash cloth in pretty warm water. I've mostly been using these microfiber wash clothes I bought on Amazon. https://smile.amazon.com/gp/product/B00LWIINUS/ref=oh_aui_search_detailpage?ie=UTF8&th=1-Press the warm wash cloth over my entire face and hold there for several seconds. Then I proceed to wipe away the oil, taking care to rinse the cloth after a couple of wipes and then using the opposite side of the wash cloth afterwards to avoid re-applying a dirty part of the cloth if it can be avoided. I sometimes use the same washcloth at night and the next morning without trouble. I never re-use the same cloth more than twice before replacing.- Once I've rinsed clean, I splash cold water on my face to close my pores. Then pat (don't rub) dry.- I've been adding a drop of tea tree oil to a couple pumps of the post-cleansing rose face oil and massaging that into the cleansed areas. I figured if I were going to break out, at least the tea tree oil might help.  I then follow up with a nightly moisturizer (like Elta MD PM moisturizer). I just saw this same Badger brand sells a Beauty Balm that some people apply at night for extra moisturizing. I am going to order that since sometimes I do get a little eczema on my forehead, and the tea tree can be a little drying even when applied with the face oil. I've applied this same face oil and drop of tea tree oil in the morning before applying my daytime moisturizer (Elta MD AM moisturizer) and/or Elta's sunscreen. Elta MD products are great if you have acne prone skin. They use excellent ingredients that don't break skin out.The scent smells very nice. It's a light and natural rose scent...nothing synthetic. I don't know where this has been all my life. I'm so glad I started researching this and stumbled upon these products on Amazon! For reference, it's been a month and I still have about 1/4 the bottle of cleansing oil left and about 50% of the post-cleansing oil remaining in the original bottles.I hope this helps you in your decision!
